titleStmt.title: Love crownd with victory. A merry dialogue betwixt an old rich countrey batchellour, and a young witty London virgin. With allowance. To the tune, Ile crown thee my dearest &c. Digby's farwel, or Packingtons pound

publicationStmt.publisher: printed for P. Brooksby at the Hospital Gate in West-smithfield,

notesStmt.note: Verse - "My dear canst thou love me, I pray tell me true,".
Publication date conjectured by Wing, which estimates 1672-1695.
In two parts; woodcuts at head of first part.
Reproduction of the original in the Bodleian Library.
